MESSAGE.value: added a time to cut all the videos to avoid the environment being too repetitive
minor changes / nothing
- edits in the trajectory plotting to make it more pretty - made plot_selected_data more pretty, adding pictures in legends and spreading plate points on the x axis
- debug in the pixelwise speeds - replaced pandas with datatable format for the trajectories (for speed reasons)
now properly plots the pixel total visit time as a fx of distance to the edge (taking zero visit pixels into account), and the average centroid speed as a function of distance to the edge
new script that makes nice timelines showing in which patch the worms are at each time step
worse quality (because if I let matplotlib lower the quality, the interpolation is disgusting)
added first visit duration plotting, and titles that are better for paper figures in other visit duration related plots
Adjusted axis sizes for plotting in plot_selected_data, and made the colored lines in the legend more pretty
Made the exchange matrix plot nicer, images in axis labels
Now when conditions are pooled together, they all have the same weight in the averaging Errorbars are still dumb (min and max of the errorbars of the conditions)
Added saving of transition matrices but it's not much faster Added curved and looping arrows to the transition probability plots!!!
plots interframe time
add nb of datapoints in table for alfonso
now plots timelines with filling of tracking holes
added option to conserve visit order in transition model + return_value_list() function (to differentiate first visit from 2nd from 3rd etc.)
reformated pixelwise speeds there was extra brackets
corrected patch mask computation by sorting reference holes properly
added colored errorbars, with outline if it's just one point
added rgb conversion to send colors to alfonso
excluded more videos (>10000 tracked points)
debug for model generation
correct_time_stamps() now returns if there was a pbm with the time, to not include those in the interframe time computation
